paragraphs.content: Chapter 7
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 7

paragraphs.content: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

paragraphs.content: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

paragraphs.content: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

paragraphs.content: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

paragraphs.content: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

paragraphs.content: ¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

paragraphs.content: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

paragraphs.content: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

paragraphs.content: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

paragraphs.content: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

paragraphs.content: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
paragraphs.contentHtml: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

paragraphs.content: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

paragraphs.content: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
paragraphs.contentHtml: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

paragraphs.content: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

paragraphs.content: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

paragraphs.content: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

paragraphs.content: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

paragraphs.content: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

paragraphs.content: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

paragraphs.content: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

paragraphs.content: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

paragraphs.content: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
paragraphs.contentHtml: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

paragraphs.content: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

paragraphs.content: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

paragraphs.content: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

paragraphs.content: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
